text: Visited this place recently as part of a school trip. I was truly impressed with the place and how Singapore plans for its future on being sustainable. The thinking behind this was very futuristic. Good place for kids to learn and many interactive activities. Best part was the guide. He was so expressive and kids were definitely drawn to his presentation. Kudos to him!

This place of interest is free of charge …suitable for all kids and adults Very educational and eye opening. So good to know what the government is planning and has in place to make Singapore liveable and sustainable for years to come. Question for you? Do you understand how to recycle properly?

i visited the Singapore Sustainable Gallery for an educational trip, and it was an incredible experience! The exhibits were really informative and eye-opening. It’s a great place to learn about sustainability in an engaging way. highly recommend it for anyone interested in the environment.

Amazing place. Free entrance, no need booking in advance. A lot to learn in this place and futuristic experience too! 1 hour visit was few for us that are enthusiastic with social and environmental development at Mission Makers AI.

The Sustainable Singapore Gallery is a captivating showcase of the nation's commitment to environmental stewardship. Through interactive exhibits and engaging displays, visitors gain insight into Singapore's innovative urban solutions and sustainability initiatives. The gallery's design is both modern and eco-friendly, reflecting the principles it promotes. Highlights include informative panels on waste management, green architecture, and climate resilience. The staff are knowledgeable and enthusiastic, enhancing the experience with their insights. Overall, the gallery is a must-visit for anyone interested in sustainability, offering a hopeful vision of a greener future.
